answers.answer: Your suppose to take that test on an empty stomach...just drink and and not think about it...drink plenty of water before and after.goodluck
And yes they will have you to keep repeat the test...its to check to see if you have pregnancy diabetes...which could be passed on to your unborn if not caught early on in pregnancy.
I didn't have to fast to take it so it depends on the Dr. Maybe trying deep breaths and bringing something as a distraction like headphones and music or something. Good luck!
I had to fast to take it and even after 1 sip i thought I was going to throw up. I would take a big large gulp and then a sip of water. I was still wicked nauseous but it stayed down.
they tell you not to eat nor drink anything within 12 hours of taking the test. I go in two weeks. good lick on hour next time
Both pregnancies I've been told not to eat drink or chew gum once you begin drinking it

My apt was later in the day so I ate at about 11 n then I didn't eat till,after the test but do u get to choose the flavor I got a lemon lime and it wasn't,so bad more like a flat pop n I hate drinking stuff I don't take cold medicine or anything like that but I did it I think the flavor is the,worst,part so if u could,do a flavor,that's not so intense maybe

I wasn't supposed to drink or eat before it either. I did the one hour test, and at my testing they have me three little cans of Mountain Dew to drink within fifteen minutes. I felt sick and woozy, just because of all the caffeine and sugar and not having it like that in months, but nothing like that stuff they give you. If I failed and had to do the three hour test then I would've had to drink the stuff you're all talking about having to take.

In my 1 hour I didn't have to fast, but with the 3 hour they told me not to eat after midnight. It could be different between hospitals though. I tried the 3 hour test 3 times. With the first two I threw it up within ten minutes and felt sick for days afterwards. It was miserable. The third time my doctor told me to try zofran before drinking it. That's the only way I would have kept it down. Turns out I have gestational diabetes.

Thanks. I'll try not eating, they didn't tell me not to but it's worth a try sense clearly eating isn't working and no I don't get to choose my flavor I got like a orange kool aid one both times which taste like 5cups of sugar is added Smh.
